Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of drug overdoses as the second-most common cause of death in New Hampshire, as it fails to include other causes such as heart disease, chronic lower respiratory disease, and stroke.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide comprehensive data on all causes of death in New Hampshire.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that drug overdoses are the second-most common cause of death in New Hampshire without considering other potential causes.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the ranking of causes of death in New Hampshire, such as heart disease, chronic lower respiratory disease, and stroke, which are not included in the claim.
